title: Italian Seasoning Recipe
description: This homemade Italian seasoning is made with a blend of herbs and spices and is super easy to throw together. Use it for all your seasoning needs!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Ingredients Herbs and Spices Recipes Seasoning Mix Recipes Italian Seasoning 4.8 (88) 54 Reviews 8 Photos This Italian seasoning blend is easy and quick to throw together. This is an excellent recipe for all your Italian seasoning needs. I like to use it for just about everything, Italian or not. Stored in an airtight container, it keeps for about 12 weeks. You can use fresh herbs you dry yourself, or store-bought dried herbs — of course, the ones you grow and dry yourself are better! Submitted by Suzanne Updated on November 16, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 8 8 8 8 Prep Time: 5 mins Total Time: 5 mins Servings: 10 Yield: 10 tablespoons Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 10 servings 4 tablespoons dried basil 2 tablespoons dried oregano 2 tablespoons dried rosemary 2 tablespoons dried marjoram 2 tablespoons dried thyme 2 tablespoons red pepper flakes Directions Gather all ingredients. Peyton Beckwith/Dotdash Meredith Video Combine basil, oregano, rosemary, marjoram, thyme, and red pepper flakes in a food processor. Peyton Beckwith/Dotdash Meredith Video Blend for 1 minute, or until desired consistency is achieved. Peyton Beckwith/Dotdash Meredith Video Peyton Beckwith/Dotdash Meredith Video Recipe Tip If you don't have marjoram, you could double the amount of oregano.   I Made It Print 236 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 14 Calories 0g Fat 3g Carbs 1g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 10 Calories 14 % Daily Value * Total Fat 0g 1% Saturated Fat 0g 1% Cholesterol 0mg 0% Sodium 3mg 0% Total Carbohydrate 3g 1% Dietary Fiber 2g 7% Total Sugars 0g Protein 1g 1% Vitamin C 2mg 2% Calcium 73mg 6% Iron 3mg 16% Potassium 84mg 2% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Italian Seasoning 01 of 08 Photo by  Peyton Beckwith/Dotdash Meredith Video 02 of 08 Photo by  Yoly 03/05/2024 I made half the recipe and it was just enough to fill my spice jar. This is delicious. I'll never buy Italian Seasoning again! Thanks for the recipe. 03 of 08 Photo by  WokPan16 02/03/2020 04 of 08 Photo by  kspangler 01/03/2019 05 of 08 Photo by  Meighen Rees 01/28/2016 06 of 08 Photo by  Linda Farrell 06/25/2011 This recipe make a lot so I cut it down by half. Very easy to put together. I use this to make my homemade salad dressings and also in my homemade sauces. It's great sprinkled over chicken and fish. It's great when I can control the sodium content! 07 of 08 Photo by  pomplemousse 12/09/2008 Very easy and good. Used in a recipe that called for italian seasoning and it worked fine. Next time, though, not gonna use the food processor. I'll use my grinder or something. The ground pepper was killing me! 08 of 08 Photo by  Scotdog 11/09/2008 1 You’ll Also Love Herbs de Provence 71 Ratings Italian Seasoning II 118 Ratings Creole Seasoning Blend 515 Ratings Greek Spice Rub 10 Ratings Spicy Herb Seasoning 4 Ratings Dry Spice Rub for Lamb or Beef 18 Ratings Beef and Prime Rib Rub 8 Ratings Jim Goode's BBQ Beef Rub 36 Ratings Hugh's Dry Rub 318 Ratings CCRyder's Smoker Rib Rub 86 Ratings Chef John's All-Purpose Steak Rub and Barbecue Dry Rub 2 Ratings Tennessee Rubdown 31 Ratings Homemade Herb Salt 13 Ratings Johnny's Spice Rub 228 Ratings Mexican Dry Rub 12 Ratings Chicken Seasoning Blend 204 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
